sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The United Nations Security Council denounces Moscow's claims that four regions of Ukraine have voted to join Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Long queues build up at the border between Russia and Kazakhstan as thousands continue to flee a possible call-up for the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Experts say underwater activity in the Baltic Sea points to sabotage as the most likely cause of gas leaks in two pipelines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Members of the UN Security Council have denounced Russia following the Kremlin's claim that residents of a large swathe of Ukraine voted overwhelmingly to join Russia in stage-managed referendums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: stage-managed referendums. Speaking during a meeting of the Council, the Ukrainian president said his country will not negotiate with Vladimir Putin after the polls in four Moscow-held regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Â«Russia's recognition of the pseudo-referendums as normal, implementation of the so-called Crimean scenario and yet another attempt to annex Ukrainian territory means that there's nothing to talk about with the current president of Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Linda Thomas-Greenfield, US ambassador to the United Nations, called the referendums shams and said they were predetermined in Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the West will never recognize Russia's annexation of Ukrainian territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg called the referendums a blatant violation of international law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: JENS STOLTENBERG, NATO Secretary General of State The Sham referendums, the nuclear rhetoric, combined with also the mobilization of armed forces in Russia, all of this is a serious escalation of the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow installed officials in the four regions claimed those who voted showed almost total support for joining Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They said that ballots cast in favor of annexation range from 87 percent to 99 percent across the four Ukrainian territories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And that turnout was high at 75 percent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The UN says it will table a resolution condemning the so-called referendums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some residents of territory retaken by Ukraine have started to return to their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They include Andriy Prishko from Slatyn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The village in the Kharkiv region is near to the country's northeastern border with Russia. It was badly damaged in the fighting after the Russian invasion in February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Well, now, after the house was destroyed, I'm living in this shed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's the only thing left undestroyed. I arrived and I've already built a stove myself." With winter fast approaching, Andriy faces some challenging conditions. It could take a long time and a lot of work and money to bring his home back to the way it was before Russia invaded his country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Long queues build up at the Vizhnevka border crossing from Russia to Kazakhstan

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: as thousands continue to flee a possible call-up for the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: About 98,000 Russians have crossed into Kazakhstan in the last week, and those willing to testify are unambiguous about their motives for traveling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The mobilization was announced as partial, but according to the documents, it appears to be full, says this man.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And the president's words do not correspond to what is written on the paper.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The people standing here are afraid that sooner or later a full mobilization will be announced and then no one will be able to cross the borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some, too, are traveling by train.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The price of taxes to the border has become unaffordable for most.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Kazakhstan has promised not to send them back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The territorial integrity of states must be respected, said President Tokayev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I have always spoken about this openly and clearly in the international arena.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Tokayev also said Kazakhstan won't recognize the referendums in Ukraine's occupied territories, a defiant stand from a country that's traditionally been seen as an ally of Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Gas continues to pour into the Baltic Sea from three separate leaks on the Nord Stream 1 and 2 pipelines, as experts say it could have been sabotage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Seismologists in Sweden and Denmark say two sharp spikes in undersea activity indicate possible explosions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said that if sabotages prove to be the cause, then whoever did it should expect the strongest possible response.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: She was commenting after a phone call with the Danish Prime Minister, Meta Fredriksson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sweden's Prime Minister also says the leaks are most likely to have been a deliberate act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have Swedish information, but have also taken note of information from our contacts with Denmark, and based on that have come to the conclusion that this is probably a deliberate act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It is therefore probably a matter of sabotage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Danish and Swedish authorities issued navigation warnings after two unexplained leaks were detected on Nord Stream 1.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They came shortly after a separate gas leak was detected on a second pipeline, Nord Stream 2.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Nord Stream 1 was shut down by Moscow earlier this month for an indefinite period of time in retaliation for Western sanctions over the invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia has been accused of weaponizing energy supplies in retaliation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ten supply companies are warning there could be a shortage of drinking water in the Netherlands

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: within a few years. They say the system is reaching its limits due to drought, salinization and increasing demand for water as the population and the economy grow. The companies say they can't guarantee that 900,000 planned new homes will have access to drinking water on time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The UK's heir to the throne, William and his wife Catherine,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: have made their first visit to Wales since becoming the new Prince and Princess of Wales.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: William automatically inherited the title on the death of his grandmother Queen Elizabeth when his father, the previous Prince of Wales, became King. The visit came as media reports said William had no plans for any kind of investiture ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Up to 8,600 teachers are expected to join in a strike over pay in Norway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some students haven't received education since the new term started in August.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Three major unions are involved in the action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On Sunday, talks on an agreement between teachers and employer organisations fail to find a solution to the dispute.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After the victory of the right-wing coalition in Italy's election,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: the country now awaits the formation of a government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The coalition is led by Giorgia Meloni, whose Brothers of Italy party won the most votes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: When she becomes prime minister, as expected, she'll be Italy's first woman in the post.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The next couple of weeks are going to be crucial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: That's the moment when Giorgio Meloni and her coalition partners will be discussing key ministerial appointments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: According to analysts, it's going to go pretty fast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On the 13th of October, Italy's new parliament will sit for the first time after the election and a new government will be sworn in just after that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Analysts say that this could even happen by the end of October. It takes 30 days on average for a new government to be formed over here in Italy. Back in 2018 it took even three months but it's not going to be the case this time around and that's because a clear majority has emerged from these elections. So discussions are still ongoing with regards in particular to Matteo Salvini's future role.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The leader of the League party would like to be appointed Italy's interior minister, although his party has suffered a major defeat in these elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So we'll see what Giorgio Meloni will decide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So discussions are very much important as well as reaching an agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In fact, Giorgio Meloni's aim is to try and keep the coalition together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Giorgio Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The British government is facing renewed political pressure after the International Monetary Fund

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: issued a stinging attack on new Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng's controversial mini-budget.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A range of tax cuts funded by borrowing has sent the pound tumbling, and now many mortgage lenders have stopped offering fixed-rate loans to house buyers because of fears over rising interest rates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Given elevated inflation pressures in many countries, including the UK, we do not recommend large and untargeted fiscal packages at this juncture, the IMF said. It's important that fiscal policy does not work at cross-purposes to monetary policy. Keir Starmer's opposition Labour Party has a 17-point lead in one opinion poll, and he went on the offensive at the party's annual conference in Liverpool.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Higher interest rates, higher inflation, higher borrowing and for what? Not for you, not for working people, for tax cuts for the richest 1% in our society. Don't forget, don't forgive. The only way to stop this is with a Labour government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the British retail consortium says prices in UK shops rose by 5.7% in the year until September, a record jump since it began its index in 2002. A lower pound is likely to push inflation even higher in the coming months.
